content:
alicia: A compound is a substance that is made up of two or more different types of atoms that are chemically bonded together. These atoms cannot be separated by physical means. An example of a compound is water, which is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom that are chemically bonded together to form the molecule H2O.

On the other hand, a mixture is a combination of two or more substances that are physically combined but not chemically bonded. This means that the substances in a mixture can be separated by physical means, such as filtration or distillation. An example of a mixture is a salad, which is made up of different vegetables that are physically combined, but not chemically bonded together. The vegetables can be separated by picking them out or using a strainer.

whoops was that 7th grade??
